item.title: Selection Results for Dalai Lama Trust and DOE Scholarship 2018
item.dc:creator: Sherig Dragya
item.description: Department of Education, CTA is happy to announce the list of selected students for Dalai Lama Trust Scholarship and DoE annual scholarship for the year 2018 for UG Professional, UG General, Vocational and Diploma courses.   A total of 388 scholarship for the category is being awarded this year, which include 15 scholarship for Higher...

item.title: Education Department Announces UWC New Horizon Scholarship Recipients
item.dc:creator: Sherig Dragya
item.description: The Department of Education is pleased to announce the recipients of the New Horizon Scholarship to the United World Colleges. The four recipients who have been accepted in their respective colleges are:-   Tenzin Gyaltsen – UWC USA (US) Dickyi Lhamo – UWC Red Cross Nordic (Norway) Dhesal Khando – UWC Thailand (Thailand) Tenzin...

item.title: CBSE Declares AISSE Class 10 Result – 2018
item.dc:creator: Sherig Dragya
item.description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) declared the Class 10 Board Examination (AISSE) results 2018 on 29th May afternoon. Out of 1269 students appeared in the AISSE held in March 2018, 1110 students have passed, 150 students have been placed in the compartment category and 9 students could not clear the exam.   The...

item.title: AISSCE Result 2018 of Tibetan Schools Improved
item.dc:creator: Sherig Dragya
item.description: The Central Board of Secondary Education, Delhi declared the results of AISSCE 2018 on Saturday, 26 May 2018. Out of 1193 students who appeared in class 12 exam in March 2018, a total of 1140 have passed. The overall pass percentage this year is 95.56 which has increased by 8.64 percent from last year with...

item.title: Interview Result Out !!!
item.dc:creator: Sherig Dragya
item.description: The Department of Education, CTA Dharamsala hereby announces the consolidated result of selection interview held in Dharamsala and Bylakuppe from 26 – 28 February 2018 and 11 – 12 March 2018 respectively. The waiting list shown against each post will be valid for a period of six months from the date of announcement of result....
